All Desserts

32 items from 8 regions

Egypt

Kunafa

Shredded phyllo dough layered with sweet cheese, soaked in fragrant rose syrup and topped with crushed pistachios.

Egypt

Basbousa

Semolina cake soaked in aromatic syrup, crowned with almonds. A texture that melts on the tongue.

Egypt

Om Ali

Egyptian bread pudding with milk, nuts, and raisins. A royal dessert with a legendary origin.

Egypt

Kahk

Ancient Egyptian cookies filled with malban or nuts, dusted with powdered sugar. A taste of history.

Egypt

Qatayef

Stuffed pancakes filled with cream or nuts, folded into perfect half-moons and fried to golden perfection.

Turkey

Baklava

Paper-thin phyllo layers with butter and pistachios, soaked in syrup. The crown jewel of Turkish confection.

Turkey

Lokum

Turkish delight — gelatinous cubes of rose, pistachio, or citrus, dusted with powdered sugar.

Turkey

Kunefe

Shredded wheat filled with cheese, soaked in syrup, topped with pistachios. Hot, crispy, gooey perfection.

Turkey

Sutlac

Baked rice pudding with caramelized top. Comfort in every spoonful, perfected over centuries.

China

Mooncakes

Lotus paste and salted egg yolk encased in delicate pastry, stamped with intricate patterns. A festival in every bite.

China

Tangyuan

Glutinous rice balls in warm, sweet ginger syrup. Roundness symbolizes family reunion.

China

Egg Tarts

Flaky, buttery crust with silky smooth custard center. A Portuguese-Chinese fusion masterpiece.

China

Mango Sago

Chilled mango puree with tapioca pearls and coconut milk. A refreshing tropical escape.

America

NYC Cookies

Giant, gooey chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges and a soft center. The city that never sleeps deserves dessert this good.

America

Fudge Brownies

Dense, fudgy chocolate squares with that coveted crackly top. Pure chocolate intensity.

America

Banana Pudding

Layers of vanilla wafers, fresh bananas, and creamy pudding. Southern comfort in a cup.

America

S'mores Bars

Graham cracker crust, chocolate ganache, toasted marshmallow topping. Campfire nostalgia, elevated.

Greece

Galaktoboureko

Semolina custard wrapped in crispy phyllo, bathed in citrus-scented syrup. A textural masterpiece.

Greece

Loukoumades

Greek doughnut holes drizzled with honey and cinnamon. Crispy outside, airy inside.

Greece

Kataifi

Shredded phyllo wrapped around nuts, soaked in syrup. The cousin of baklava, distinct in texture.

France

Mille-feuille

Thousands of layers of puff pastry with vanilla cream. A architectural marvel of butter and air.

France

Macarons

Delicate almond meringue cookies with ganache or buttercream filling. Colorful, crisp, and chewy.

France

Éclairs

Choux pastry filled with cream and topped with glossy chocolate. A classic of French patisserie.

France

Crème Brûlée

Rich custard with caramelized sugar top. The crack of the spoon is part of the experience.

Italy

Tiramisu

Coffee-soaked ladyfingers layered with mascarpone cream and cocoa. Pick me up, indeed.

Italy

Cannoli

Crispy fried shells filled with sweet ricotta, chocolate chips, and candied fruit. Sicilian perfection.

Italy

Panna Cotta

Silky cooked cream with berry compote. Elegant simplicity at its finest.

Italy

Sfogliatella

Shell-shaped pastry with ricotta filling and hundreds of crispy layers. A Neapolitan treasure.

Saudi Arabia

Maamoul

Semolina cookies filled with dates or nuts, molded in intricate wooden forms. Eid essential.

Saudi Arabia

Luqaimat

Golden fried dumplings drizzled with date syrup. Crispy outside, soft inside, utterly addictive.

Saudi Arabia

Dates & Tahini

Medjool dates stuffed with tahini and topped with pistachios. Simple, ancient, perfect.

Saudi Arabia

Basbousa Bil Qishta

Saudi variant of basbousa with clotted cream center. A luxurious twist on a classic.
